Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Charlie Sheen, Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker', 'Initial release date': '2009-09-29', 'Language': 'English', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL1000103562DVD', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '4 hours and 39 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 29, 2009', 'Actors': 'Chris Tucker, Jackie Chan, Charlie Sheen', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Although I don't like foul language at all, I am very offended by the cursing that references our Savior.  I didn't realize there was so much of it because it is edited out when watching these on network TV.  I so enjoy the action and comedy between the two characters.  Too bad it is ruined by the cursing.  I only got through Rush Hour, and that with great difficulty.
Review Title: I miss the language editing for TV
Rating: 3.0

Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
['Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory 40th Anniversary Edition (DVD)', 'Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of a musical fantasy for the young, and the young at heart. The mysterious candy maker extraordinaire Willy Wonka (Gene Wilder) hides a Golden Ticket inside five of his famous candy bars. The kids who find them are invited on a grand tour of the wondrous, wacky Wonka factory, and a chance for an even grander prize -- if they can resist temptation. The delightful musical score includes the hit song "The Candyman." From Roald Dahl\'s classic novel, produced by David Wolper ("Roots," "The Thorn Birds") and nominated for an Academy Award.', ']]>']

I like both versions of Willy Wonka because they each offer something a little different.  Both have basically the same great story.  Being a chocoholic myself, who wouldn't want to own a candy factory?
One of my favorite movies
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Zoltan Korda'], 'Producers': ['Alexander Korda'], 'Starring': ['John Clements', 'Ralph Richardson', 'C. Aubrey Smith'], 'Studio': ['The Criterion Collection']}
This is a great story of courage.  We will not always be understood by others.  It is most important that we understand ourselves.  In doing so, we will be better able to understand and love others.
One of my favorite movies

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user enjoys films that explore family values, blending humor with the complexities of familial relationships. They appreciate varied perspectives on relationships, both positive and negative. They have a fondness for musical fantasy films that evoke nostalgia and whimsy, reinforcing their affinity for content suitable for both children and adults.

- **Humor Appreciation:** Prefers comedic elements in films, seeking light-hearted narratives that entertain while provoking thought.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user maintains a favorable outlook on their movie choices, with an average rating of 4.8. Their recent rating of 3.0 reflects a more critical stance towards specific films that contain excessive foul language, indicating a sensitivity to language despite their comfort with mature themes overall.

- **Content Sensitivity:** Generally comfortable with mature themes, the user has expressed discontent with foul language, particularly when it references religious figures, suggesting a more nuanced approach to content sensitivity.

- **Language & Accessibility:** Values films available in English and appreciates accessibility features such as audio descriptions and closed captions.

- **Director & Actor Affinity:** Exhibits loyalty to specific directors and actors, often appreciating adaptations of classic literature, and consistently enjoys comedic-action pairings, balancing humor with adventure.

The user's recent interactions further emphasize their appreciation for narratives that inspire courage and self-understanding, contributing to their overall enjoyment of emotionally impactful storytelling.
